summary: This Q&A report provides publicly available information on incarcerations of noncitizens in the U.S. while we continue ongoing work on related topics. For example: Federal agencies don't collect citizenship information for all people in state and local facilities, where about 90% of incarcerated people are held The number of noncitizens incarcerated by the Bureau of Prisons at the end of 2022 was 33% less than...
title: Noncitizens in the U.S.: Public Information on Federal Incarcerations
